sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"扎牢，捆，绑"之意。
means: fasten ： 指把某物牢牢地拴在、钉在或锁在另一物上，使不能任意移动。
tie ： 普通用词，指用绳索等将东西扎紧捆牢。
bind ： 多指把两个或两个以上的人或物牢牢地系或扎在一起。
secure ： 指将某物紧紧地固定起来，使之完全无损。
chain ： 专指用链条或金属环将某人或某物锁住或系住。

sentence.Network_cn: 尽管很热，他还是脱掉工作服换上了西装和领带。

sentence.Network_en: He was a big man, smartly dressed in a suit and tie.
sentence.Network_cn: 他身材高大，穿着西服打着领带，非常帅气。

sentence.Network_en: They'll meet the winners of the first round tie.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们将迎战第一轮淘汰赛中的胜者。

lj.lj_ls: 她把现金都投入到长期投资里

jx.jx_en_mean: restrict someone to a particular situation or place

lj.lj_ly: she didn't want to be tied down by a full-time job.
lj.lj_ls: 她不想受全职工作的约束。

jx.jx_en_mean: cause something to fit or harmonize with something else (or fit or harmonize with something)
jx.jx_cn_mean: （使）配合得当，（使）协调；（与…）相一致

lj.lj_ly: her husband is able to &B{tie in} his shifts &B{with} hers at the hospital.
lj.lj_ls: 她丈夫能够使自己的轮班与她在医院的轮班协调一致。

lj.lj_ly: she may have developed ideas which don't necessarily &B{tie in with} mine.
lj.lj_ls: 她可能已有自己的想法，不一定要和我的一致。

jx.jx_en_mean: bind someone's legs and arms together or bind someone to something so that they cannot move or escape

lj.lj_ly: robbers tied her up and ransacked her home.
lj.lj_ls: 强盗们把她捆起来后洗劫了她的家。

jx.jx_en_mean: bind or fasten something securely with rope, cord, or similar
bring something to a satisfactory conclusion; settle

lj.lj_ly: he said he had a business deal to tie up.
lj.lj_ls: 他说他有一桩生意要处理。

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring into or have a close or effective relation; connect or coordinate
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使结合成一整体：使具有密切或有效的关系；联系或协调

lj.lj_ls: 这两件事无法协调；把影片宣传与作品销售联系起来

jx.jx_en_mean: To impede the progress of; block

lj.lj_ly: She was tied up in a meeting all morning. The phone was tied up for an hour.
lj.lj_ls: 她整个上午都在开会。电话忙了一个小时

jx.jx_en_mean: To place (funds) so as to make inaccessible for other uses
jx.jx_cn_mean: 不动用（资金）：把（资金）用于某方面以使之无法挪作它用

lj.lj_ly: tied up her cash in long-term investments.
lj.lj_ls: 她把现金都投入到长期投资里

jx.jx_en_mean: To become intoxicated; go on a drinking spree.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 喝醉：变得醉的；参加畅饮狂欢

其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tīgan (verb), tēah (noun), of Germanic origin

encyclopedia.content: 汉字 拼音是“tie”的汉字有： 蛈；贴；餮；飻；铁；鉄；帖；驖；怗；銕；萜；贴；聑英文 tie KK: [] DJ: [] vt. 1. 系，拴，捆，扎[O] He tied the magazines with string. 他用绳子把杂志捆起来。 The robber tied him to a pillar. 强盗把他捆在柱子上。 2. 打锛埥犸級,系上 She tied the ribbon in a bow. 她把缎带系成一个蝴蝶结。 3. 束缚，约束 I was tied to my job by a contract. 我因订有合同而不能离职。 4. 联系，联

entry.def: If you tie two things together or tie them, you fasten them together with a knot.

example.ex: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together...
example.tran: 他把塑料袋的两头系在了一起。

example.ex: Mr Saunders tied her hands and feet.
example.tran: 桑德斯先生把她的手脚捆了起来。

entry.def: If you tie something or someone in a particular place or position, you put them there and fasten them using rope or string.

example.ex: He had tied the dog to one of the trees near the canal...
example.tran: 他把狗拴在了沟旁的一棵树上。

example.ex: He tied her hands behind her back.
example.tran: 他把她的双手绑在背后。

entry.def: If you tie a piece of string or cloth around something or tie something with a piece of string or cloth, you put the piece of string or cloth around it and fasten the ends together.

example.ex: She tied her scarf over her head...
example.tran: 她把头巾围在头上。

example.ex: Roll the meat and tie it with string...
example.tran: 把肉卷起来，用线捆扎牢。

entry.tran: 打(结或蝴蝶结)；将…打成(结或蝴蝶结)
entry.def: If you tie a knot or bow in something or tie something in a knot or bow, you fasten the ends together.

example.ex: He took a short length of rope and swiftly tied a slip knot...
example.tran: 他拿起一小截绳子，飞快地打了个活结。

example.ex: She tied a knot in her scarf...
example.tran: 她把围巾打了个结。

entry.def: When you tie something or when something ties, you close or fasten it using a bow or knot.

example.ex: He pulled on his heavy suede shoes and tied the laces.
example.tran: 他穿上厚厚的软皮鞋，系上鞋带。

example.ex: ...a long white thing around his neck that tied in front in a floppy bow.
example.tran: 他的脖子上围着个长长的白色的东西，在前面松松地打了个蝴蝶结

entry.def: A tie is a long narrow piece of cloth that is worn round the neck under a shirt collar and tied in a knot at the front. Ties are worn mainly by men.

example.ex: Jason had taken off his jacket and loosened his tie.
example.tran: 贾森已经脱下夹克，松开了领带。

entry.def: If one thing is tied to another or two things are tied, the two things have a close connection or link.

example.ex: Their cancers are not so clearly tied to radiation exposure...
example.tran: 他们的癌症是否和接触放射线有关还不太清楚。

example.ex: My social life and business life are closely tied.
example.tran: 我的社交生活和工作联系紧密。

entry.def: If you are tied to a particular place or situation, you are forced to accept it and cannot change it.

example.ex: They had children and were consequently tied to the school holidays...
example.tran: 他们有孩子，当然就受学校假期的束缚。

example.ex: I wouldn't like to be tied to catching the last train home.
example.tran: 我不想非得赶最后一趟列车回家。

entry.def: Ties are the connections you have with people or a place.

example.ex: Quebec has always had particularly close ties to France...
example.tran: 魁北克和法国一向关系特别紧密。

example.ex: I can't find any tie between her and the town...
example.tran: 我一点也看不出她和那个小镇有什么联系。

entry.def: Railroad ties are large heavy beams that support the rails of a railway track.
If two people tie in a competition or game or if they tie with each other, they have the same number of points or the same degree of success.

example.ex: Both teams had tied on points and goal difference...
example.tran: 两支队伍得分和净胜球都相当。

example.ex: Ronan Rafferty had tied with Frank Nobilo.
example.tran: 罗南·拉弗蒂和弗兰克·诺比洛打成了平局。

entry.def: In sport, a tie is a match that is part of a competition. The losers leave the competition and the winners go on to the next round.

example.ex: They'll meet the winners of the first round tie.
example.tran: 他们将迎战第一轮淘汰赛中的胜者。

means.word_mean: 1. neckwear consisting of a long narrow piece of material worn (mostly by men) under a collar and tied in knot at the front;

sentences.sentence: "he stood in front of the mirror tightening his necktie"

means.word_mean: 2. a social or business relationship;

sentences.sentence: "he was sorry he had to sever his ties with other members of the team"

means.word_mean: 3. the finish of a contest in which the score is tied and the winner is undecided;

sentences.sentence: "their record was 3 wins, 6 losses and a tie"

means.word_mean: 4. a horizontal beam used to prevent two other structural members from spreading apart or separating;

sentences.sentence: "he nailed the rafters together with a tie beam"

means.word_mean: 5. a fastener that serves to join or link;

sentences.sentence: "the walls are held together with metal links placed in the wet mortar during construction"

means.word_mean: 6. equality of score in a contest
7. (music) a slur over two notes of the same pitch; indicates that the note is to be sustained for their combined time value
8. one of the cross braces that support the rails on a railway track;

sentences.sentence: "the British call a railroad tie a sleeper"

means.word_mean: 9. a cord (or string or ribbon or wire etc.) with which something is tied;

sentences.sentence: "he needed a tie for the packages"

means.word_mean: 1. fasten or secure with a rope, string, or cord;

sentences.sentence: "They tied their victim to the chair"

means.word_mean: 2. finish a game with an equal number of points, goals, etc.;
3. limit or restrict to;

sentences.sentence: "These big jets are tied to large airports"

means.word_mean: 4. connect, fasten, or put together two or more pieces;
5. form a knot or bow in;
6. create social or emotional ties;

sentences.sentence: "The grandparents want to bond with the child"

means.word_mean: 7. perform a marriage ceremony;
8. make by tying pieces together;
9. unite musical notes by a tie

example.en: You still tie a bag on now and again.
example.zh: 你还是常常喝得醉醺醺的；

example.en: Davy had just one more drink, and then he got a hag on.
example.zh: 戴维只多喝了一杯,后来就醉了。

Sentence.sentence: In those where ties to family and community are strong, lifelong marriages can be promoted by practices such as the cultural prohibition of divorce and arranged marriages that are seen as a contract between two families, not just two individuals.
We can infer from the passage that strong family and community ties can contribute to stable marriages
After reading a book on how to address for success, he had purchased an expensive dark navy suit and golden tie.
Why did Larry purchase an expensive navy suit and golden tie

For the next three months, Michelle Kremer and 11 other Obama supporters, ages 19 to 34, will blog about life across mainstream America, with one twist: by tying all of their ideas and experiences to the new president and his administration, the bloggers will try to start a conversation about what it means to be young and politically active in America today.

sentences.en: This is a rope too heavy to tie.
sentences.cn: 这是一根重得不能打结的绳子。

jushi.english: The belt of this dress ties at the front.
jushi.chinese: 这件连衣裙的腰带在前面打结。
